newsitem.title: HONG KONG: China to list large state firms to push economy.
newsitem.headline: China to list large state firms to push economy.

text.p: China plans to list more powerful state companies in 1997 to further shake up its economy, the Shenzhen-based Securities Times said on Tuesday.
China will give listing priority to leading enterprises or those with substantial development potential, the official newspaper said in a front-page report.

China needs more than 100 billion yuan in the next few years to reform its electronics, light industrial, chemical, pharmaceutical and metallurgical sectors and plans to get much of the money from the capital markets, the newspaper said.

By the end of the century, it plans to form 30 electronics group companies with annual sales of 10 billion yuan each and 10 light industry giants with yearly sales of 2.0 billion yuan each, the newspaper added.
China's Ministry of Metallurgical Industry has chosen seven out of the country's top 10 steel enterprises to list in China or abroad, it said. It did not give details.
